title: Psychology as a mother of invention
proctitle: CHI '87: Proceedings of the SIGCHI/GI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems and Graphics Interface

references.text: Card, S.J., Moran, T.P., and Newell, A. (1983). The Psychology of Human-Computer Interaction. Hillsdale, N.J.: Erlbaum
Egan, D.E. and Gomez, L.M. (1985). Assaying, Isolating, and Accommodating Individual Differences in Learning a Complex Skill, Academic Press, Inc.

Furnas, G.W., Landauer, T.K., Gomez, L.M., and Dumais, S.T. (1983). Statistical Semantics: Analysis of the Potential Performance of Key-Word Information Systems, Bell System Technical Journal, Vol. 62, pp. 1753-1806.
Furnas, G.W., Landauer, T.K., Gomez, L.M., and Dumais, S.T. (1985). The Vocabulary Problem in Human-System Communication, Communications of the ACM- in press.
Greene, S.L., Gomez, L.M., and Devlin, S.J. (1986). A Cognitive Analysis of Database Query Production, In Proceedings of the Human Factors Society 30th Annual Meeting, Dayton, Ohio. Vol. 1, pp. 9-13.
Good, M.D., Whiteside, J.A., Wixon, D.R., Jones, S.J. (1984). Building a User-Derived Interface. ACM 27, 10, 1032-1043.
Gould, J.D., Conti, J., and Hovanyecz, T. (1983). Composing Letters with a Simulated Listening Typewriter. Communications of ACM 26,4, 295-308.
Kieras, D.E., and Polson, P.G. (1985). An approach to the formal analysis of user complexity. International Journal of Man-Machine Studies, 22, 365-394.
